column4: Can someone help me with a networking issue for Ubuntu 11.04? http://paste.ubuntu.com/645010/
reading...
I have never done this before but I think it's pretty straight forward what those rules should be.  Why not just change the eth1 to a wlan1 ?
I tried doing that, but it didn't work correctly... the file is just reset by Ubuntu after rebooting.
Let me look more into it.  Give me a few minutes
I was...
Look in /etc/modules.conf
The file contains 2 lines, the first with "lp", the second with "rtc'.
I didn't even have it were on Debian.  Still researching
eth2 is wifi I think
Back up whats in that file.
sure
What did you do to the file? What does it look like right now?
Can you pastebin it ?
I think what it did was look in the file for the interfaces.  If it finds them it follows the file.  If not it creates new entries
What are app are you trying to use that needs it to be wlan0 ?
Can you do sudo wireshark eth1  ?
Can you explain that more?
I just ran wireshark myself and it does not care what the name of the interface is.
eth1 is the wifi right?
You can get online, wireshark works.  What do you mean by 'the system' and why does it matter that 'the system' thinks it's ethernet?
Is the wifi connection online?
sure
